title: FF 86.0 not opening new tab
content: I have just updated to FF 86.0 (64 bit) on a windows 7 laptop. When I click the + sign or ctrl t to open a new tab, nothing happens. Click again and FF hangs and then get the "not responding" message. Is there a fix coming, or do I have to go back to a previous version? TIA
creator: nick.willis.shopping

title: Marcadores de Firefox con sincronización desaparecieron !!!
content:
Hola a todos. Debí reinstalar Windows desde cero en mi laptop formateando el disco duro. Bajé el instalador de FIREFOX y lo vuelvo a sincronizar. Debí reestablecer la contraseña de sincronización y al entrar y sincronizar Firefox en la laptop los marcadores que tenía desaparecieron.

Pero en mi movil Android el Firefox sincronizado si están. Cómo hago para copiarlos desde mi firefox en Android a la laptop ? O para restaurar una copia que Firefox debe tener como respaldo en su servidor ?

Adjunto imagenes de Firefox en mi Android y de Firefox en mi laptop

Les agradeceré su ayuda y sugerencias.

Gracias
creator: victor.rathgeb.tamm

title: The address bar may start empty
content: I'm using Firefox 86.0 (x64) on Windows 10. When I click on the URL in the email, the address bar may start empty. It may be displayed correctly. I changed the option "Home page and new window" from Firefox home (default) to a blank page, and it improved. After that, even if I returned to the default, it did not reproduce. Please let me know. Is this the correct specification?
creator: kiyoshi.ueno

title: Lost Bookmarks
content:
Hello, all:

I thought I could try reaching out to see about why Firefox somehow reset itself or something earlier tonight then I lost some recent bookmarks with the bookmarks I had in the bookmarks bar so I had to set it up again and am not too sure of whether it'll happen again which I hope won't. Is there a simpler way or something so I can be sure to keep the bookmarks I have since I have quite a number of them? Hope this information helps you figure out the issue I had earlier and how to not have it happen again at some point which I hope won't be the case. Thank you in advance if you reply to this post.
creator: Anduma22

title: Firefox freezing - High CPU usage spikes
content:
I don't remember exactly the date, but I think it started after a update(firefox/windows). The oldest pic I have is from 23/11/20. Firefox was running without no problems, then this started.

Gallery

The problem is High cpu usage from time to time. Making firefox slower and also freezing tabs. It's so annoying. Made me use Edge that runs incredibly smooth, I was impressed( I can even watch media in 1080p with no problem).

Then I noticed through the task manager that the 'Host service Windows font cache service' is always present, as you can see in the gallery. I didn't find anything related to that.

Tried starting in safe mode, refresh, uninstalled and installed today(24/02) and nothing worked. This is driving me crazy because I love using the browser.

My PC Setup is: Windows 10 Home i3-4130 8GB ram no video card

And I use the free avira antivirus.
creator: gabriel.willames

title: Freezing up and not moving
content: I would like to know how to fix my problem. I chat with my son most nights & facebook just freezes up after a few minutes or so, I can usually get it unfrozen by restarting my pc, what else can I do? We chat sometimes for a couples of hours, but fb hardly ever works correctly, is is very frustrating. Email me with any suggestions, OK? - Thanks
creator: Albrit2

title: firefox homepage and gmail
content: Firefox homepage has suddenly started appearing as narrow vertical page. When going to fullscreen, menu bar disappears but reappears when cursor is on the next toolbar down. When it reappears there is no yellow minimize button. Also, can load gmail through Safari but not through firefox
creator: alsaguma

title: print page in browser
content: in one of the recent previous versions it was possible to print the webpage e.g. to pdf. when there was a lot of other info/characters on the preview, you could choose to simplify the page and a lot of text over text was gone, now it that not possible anymore; print web pages is gobbled up to that the basic web text is not readable anymore. Would it be possible to get this 'simplify page' back on the new print window? I have not a screenshot with that option to show, sorry for that. Thank you in advance. Theo
creator: adfly1

title: Preferences for PDF files
content:
After Firefox updated to version 86 yesterday a couple of my users are being prompted to select what they would like Firefox to do with a PDF file each time they download one. They set it to open in Foxit Reader and checked the box to do it automatically each time but it always goes back to the default setting. I confirmed that the Application settings in Options is set to use Foxit Reader for PDFs and I even followed the troubleshooting step for this issue and renamed the handlers.json file.

Also each time they try to download a PDF a prompt comes up asking for an admin password (see the 3rd image). These computers are on a domain, so the UAC prompt isn't unusual but we don't restrict them from being able to download files. But I'm having the same issue as well and I'm not on the domain, so I think this is more of a symptom then a cause.

Is this a bug in the latest update? I was troubleshooting a printer setting issue for them the day before yesterday. Did some testing on my computer and theirs, got it worked out that Foxit works best for their needs when printing a PDF from a web app. Then yesterday afternoon they began to have issues where they couldn't print at all. I checked it out and all of our computers updated to Firefox v86 and everything is now working differently now in terms of handling PDFs.

Thanks in advanced,

Josh
creator: jleary
